edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math

Class Scale

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.BaseVector<Scale>
      • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.Scale

  • public class Scale
extends BaseVector<Scale>
    Represents a scaling of a 2D vector. A scale in general can be (loosely) thought of as a size.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scale()
      Creates a new scale that defaults to <1.0, 1.0>, (ie no scaling).
      Scale(BaseVector<?> other)
      Creates a new scaling from the input vector (which can be another scaling).
      Scale(double scale)
      Creates a new scaling that scales x and y by the same amount.
      Scale(double scaleX, double scaleY)
      Creates a new scaling with the given scales for the x and y components.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T extends BaseVector<?>>
      T      		 applyTo(T vector)
      Returns a copy of the input vector scaled by this scaling.
      Scale copy()
      Creates a copy of this vector.

      • Methods inherited from class edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.BaseVector

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • Scale

        public Scale(double scaleX,
             double scaleY)
        Creates a new scaling with the given scales for the x and y components.
        Parameters:
        scaleX - - x scale factor (1.0 is no scaling)
        scaleY - - y scale factor (1.0 is no scaling)

      • Scale

        public Scale(double scale)
        Creates a new scaling that scales x and y by the same amount.
        Parameters:
        scale - - scale factor (1.0 is no scaling)

      • Scale

        public Scale()
        Creates a new scale that defaults to <1.0, 1.0>, (ie no scaling).

      • Scale

        public Scale(BaseVector<?> other)
        Creates a new scaling from the input vector (which can be another scaling).
        Parameters:
        other - other vector to copy the x,y components of

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public Scale copy()
        Description copied from class: BaseVector
        Creates a copy of this vector.
        Specified by:
        copy in class BaseVector<Scale>
        Returns:
        the copy

      • applyTo

        public <T extends BaseVector<?>> T applyTo(T vector)
        Returns a copy of the input vector scaled by this scaling. E.g.: 
         Position pos = new Position(1, 2);
 Scale scale = new Scale(0.5);
 Position scaledPos = scale.applyTo(pos); // scaledPos will now be (0.5, 1.0)
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the vector to scale (inferred from the argument)
        Parameters:
        vector - vector scale
        Returns:
        a copy of the original vector, scaled by this vector
